gurmukhi: dIpk pqMg sMg pRIiq iek AMgI hoie cMdRmw ckor Gn cwqiRk n hoq hY
transliteration: Deepak Patang Sang Preeti Ik Angee Hoi , Chandramaa Chakor Ghan Chaatrik N Hot Hai ?
translation: Love of a lamp and a moth (winged insect) is one-sided. Similarly is the love of Chakor with the moon and of rain bird (Papiha) with clouds;

gurmukhi: ckeI Aau sUr jil mIn ijau kml Ail kwst Agn miRg nwd ko audoq hY
transliteration: Chakaee Au Soor Jali Meen Jiu Kamal Ali , Kaasat Agan Mrig Naad Ko Udot Hai ?
translation: Just as love of Casarca ferruginea (Chakv) with Sun, fish with water, a bumble bee with lotus flower, wood and fire, a deer and musical sound is one-sided,

gurmukhi: ipq suq ihq Aru BwmnI Bqwr giq mwieAw Aau sMswr duAwr imtq n Coiq hY
transliteration: Pit Sout Hit Aru Bhaamanee Bhataar Gati , Maaiaa Au Sansaar Duaar Mitat N Chhoti Hai ?
translation: So is the love of father with son, wife and husband, attachment with worldly attractions is one-sided and like chronic contagious disease cannot be eradicated.

gurmukhi: gurisK sMgiq imlwp ko pRqwp swco lok prlok suKdweI Eiq poiq hY ]187]
transliteration: Gursikh Sangati Milaap Ko Prataap Saacho , Lok Paralok Soukhadaaee Aoti Poti Hai ?187?
translation: Contrary to the above union and grandeur of the True Guru with his Sikhs is True. It is uniform like warp and woof of a cloth. It is comforting in the world beyond. (187)
